title.narrative: Improving access to medications for noncommunicable disease and mental health

description.narrative: The project will fill the gap in access to noncommunicable disease medications for 3 months and the gap in specialized mental health medications for 6 months. A total of 58 medications will be procured. A total of 93,000 beneficiaries will have access to subsidized noncommunicable disease and specialized mental health medications via the network of centres that are spread across the country. For noncommunicable disease medications, the total population targeted is 91,500 persons and for the specialized mental health medications, the total population targeted is 1,500. The target population for this Health engagement is vulnerable Lebanese, Syrian refugees, and other vulnerable populations (i.e. Iraqi) accessing primary health care centres and dispensaries including those providing mental health services.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Improving access to medications for noncommunicable disease and mental health

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS LEBANON UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Noncommunicable disease medications are provided to vulnerable beneficiaries in 420 centres that are part of the chronic medications program
Number of vulnerable beneficiaries provided with noncommunicable disease medications under this project
Specialized mental health medications are provided to vulnerable beneficiaries through 4 community mental health centres in Lebanon
